result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornelius C. Arthur was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
**Pay DNA surcharge.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with felons or drug dealers.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Obtain employment.  Obtain and maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornelius C. Arthur

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Aileen Henry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 1/8/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 10-17-14 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 11-3-14 @ 8:15am. Bond continued.

1:48 pm    Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney  Aileen Henry.  Clerk:  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 9-9-14 @ 10:00 am.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Carl Johnson. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Johnson requests to withdraw due to conflict of interest. Court grants request. SPD's Office to appoint new counsel. Attorney status on 8-27-14 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.

151 p.m.  Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E King.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 8/20/14 @ 845 a.m.  Warrant vacated.   $2500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Pittmon H or his residence.
961.41(1)(cm)1r Manf/Deliv Cocaine
Warrant served, def. in custody.  Return on warrant today at 1:00 before Commis. Mason.
